page_about.info_intro: Hi! I'm Edu, a passionate programmer working both in frontend and backend. My journey started in a completely different world — nutrition. There, I developed an analytical and detail-oriented mindset. Over time, that mindset became the strong foundation for my evolution in web development.
page_about.info_total: Today, as a full stack developer, I enjoy creating complete and functional experiences. Personally, I'm a calm and curious person. In my free time, you’ll find me at the gym, riding my motorcycle, or researching random topics. I'm always looking to learn and grow, and I love sharing everything I discover along the way. Thanks for visiting my portfolio — I hope you enjoy what you see!

one.containExplain: Recognized for my contributions to multiple projects, including a custom user dashboard that improved user experience and enhanced client engagement.
one.containAptInfo:
- Developed a custom user dashboard for personalized service management.
- Collaborated with designers during sprint planning to ensure alignment with goals and improved usability.
- Implemented new features to boost customer acquisition and retention through scalable solutions.
- Played a key role in developing an internal mobile app, which automated manual tasks and reduced resource usage across departments.
- Worked closely with designers and developers in an Agile environment to meet deadlines.
- Led the product presentation to investors, highlighting its positive business impact.

one.containExplain: Training in NestJS focused on scalable backend development with TypeScript. I learned how to build RESTful APIs, structure projects using a modular architecture, and apply best practices such as dependency injection and data validation.
one.containAptInfo: - RESTful API development with NestJS, modular and maintainable architecture, dependency injection, data validation and serialization, handling of controllers, services, and middlewares, integration with databases (TypeORM/Prisma), use of Pipes, Guards, and Interceptors, authentication and authorization (JWT, Passport).

two.containExplain: Training focused on Angular 19 following best practices. I learned to build scalable applications using components, services, routing, reactive forms, state management, and API consumption.
two.containAptInfo: - SPA development with Angular 19, component-based architecture, reactive and template-driven forms, routing and lazy loading, dependency injection and services, REST API integration, observables and reactive programming with RxJS, performance and SEO improvement with SSR.

three.containExplain: Course focused on user experience design. I learned how to research user needs, create wireframes and prototypes, and apply usability principles to improve digital product interaction.
three.containAptInfo: - User-centered research, creation of wireframes and interactive prototypes, information architecture, usability and accessibility principles, user testing, and interface validation.

four.containExplain: Course aimed at mastering the most popular framework of the JavaScript library React.
four.containAptInfo: - Next.js, React, TypeScript, Zustand, Redux, JWT, Docker, Prisma.

five.containExplain: Course focused on relational databases with SQL. I learned how to model data, perform complex queries, optimize searches, and apply normalization best practices.

six.containExplain: Full Stack Web Development Master's program at ConquerBlocks, focused on hands-on learning of modern frontend and backend technologies. I gained experience building real-world applications using JavaScript, Node.js, databases, and modern frameworks.
six.containAptInfo: - Linux, Git, GitHub, HTML, CSS, TailwindCSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Angular, Node.js, SQL.

one.containExplain: Web project to discover which cocktails and drinks you can make with the ingredients you have, with an integrated recipe book and a favorites section.
one.containAptInfo: - HTML5, CSS, TailwindCSS, TypeScript, React, vite.

two.containExplain: This website lets you know the current and forecasted weather of your location in real time, along with other important weather-related parameters. It also allows searching weather for any place you want.
two.containAptInfo: - HTML5, CSS, TailwindCSS, TypeScript, React, vite.

three.containExplain: Easy-to-use tool to manage and plan your expenses. Helps you track your income and spending, and optimize your budget. Ideal for keeping your finances organized.

four.containExplain: Tool to track prices and variations of your favorite cryptocurrencies, allowing you to choose the currency that best fits your location. Also includes an up-to-date news section on the crypto world.
four.containAptInfo: - HTML5, CSS, TailwindCss, Vanilla JavaScript, vite.

five.containExplain: This project is an example of an e-commerce system developed with Vanilla JavaScript. It allows users to explore a variety of products, add them to a shopping cart, complete a form for shipping details, and simulate payment of the selected order.
five.containAptInfo: - HTML5, CSS, Sass, Vanilla JavaScript, vite.

six.containExplain: This project aims to address the need for sharing concise links, providing an efficient and versatile solution for URL shortening and QR code access. With an intuitive and easy-to-use platform, I aim to simplify link sharing while optimizing the user experience.
six.containAptInfo: - HTML5, CSS, Sass, Vanilla JavaScript, vite.
